title: Showers expected in Eastern Province & Mullaittivu District
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that a few showers will occur in Eastern Province and in Mullaitivu District today (13).

title: US arms flow to Ukraine again as Kremlin mulls a ceasefire proposal
byline: U.S. arms deliveries to Ukraine resumed Wednesday, officials said, a day after the Trump administration lifted its suspension of military aid for Kyiv in its fight against Russia’s invasion, and officials awaited the Kremlin’s response to a proposed 30-day ceasefire endorsed by Ukraine.

title: Sexual assault of A’pura Hospital doctor: Two including suspect’s sister arrested
byline: The sister of the suspect linked to the sexual assault of a female doctor at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital, along with another individual, has been arrested, police confirmed.

title: Nationwide GMOA strike ends today, A’pura Hospital strike continues
byline: The token strike launched by the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) across all hospitals in the country in protest of the sexual assault of a female doctor concluded at 8.00 a.m. today (13).

title: 21 hostages killed by insurgents after train attack in Pakistan, all others freed
byline: Insurgents who attacked a passenger train carrying 440 passengers in restive southwestern Pakistan killed 21 hostages before security forces killed all 33 of the assailants, and all other passengers were rescued, officials said Wednesday.

title: Intel appoints chip industry veteran Lip-Bu Tan as CEO
byline: Intel on Wednesday named former board member and chip industry veteran Lip-Bu Tan as its CEO and signaled the struggling but storied chipmaker was unlikely to split up its chip-design and manufacturing operations.

title: Several radiation machines at Apeksha Hospital breakdown disrupting cancer treatment
byline: The Government Radiological Technologists Association states that three out of the five radiation machines used to treat cancer patients at Apeksha Hospital in Maharagama have broken down.

title: Body of youth who died under suspicious circumstances found under flyover
byline: The body of a young man who has died under suspicious circumstances has been found under the flyover near the expressway at the Keeriyagodella Junction on the Angunakolapelessa-Abeysekaragama road.

title: Doctors and staff call off strike at A’pura Hospital
byline: The doctors and the staff at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital have called off their strike after discussions with relevant authorities, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) said.

title: Election Commission hints at LG Polls date
byline: The Election Commission has announced an extension of key deadlines related to the upcoming local government elections, with the official polling date to be determined after the nomination process.

title: UNP sets deadline for SJB to decide on joint LG Polls bid
byline: The United National Party (UNP) has given the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) until March 20 to communicate its decision on contesting the upcoming local government elections jointly for the Colombo Municipal Council.

title: Indian actor Ravi Mohan to turn director this year?
byline: Actor Ravi Mohan, who has completed 20 years in the Tamil film industry as a bankable hero, is now all set to turn a director as well.

title: Russia lays out demands for talks with US on Ukraine, sources say
byline: Russia has presented the U.S. with a list of demands for a deal to end its war against Ukraine and reset relations with Washington, according to two people familiar with the matter.

title: Brother of notorious underworld figure ‘Pukudu Kanna’ arrested at BIA
byline: A brother of notorious underworld figure and organized criminal Balachandran Pushparaj, alias “Pukudu Kanna”, has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake.

title: Couple arrested while transporting ‘Ice’ in Seeduwa
byline: A male and female suspect have been arrested with a stock of ‘Ice’ (Crystal Methamphetamine) in a raid conducted last night (12) in the Liyanagemulla area of Seeduwa, based on a tip-off received by a team of officers of Seeduwa Police Station.

title: Animal census aimed at boosting agricultural productivity - Namal Karunaratne
byline: Deputy Minister of Agriculture Namal Karunaratne says that the animal census is not being conducted with the aim of obtaining completely accurate data.

title: Sexual assault of A’pura Hospital doctor: 48-hour detention order issued on suspect
byline: The suspect arrested for the sexual assault of a female doctor at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital has been ordered to be detained for 48 hours for questioning after being produced before the Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Elephant attacks person after Hindu temple procession in Kotagala
byline: An elephant brought to participate in a Perahera (procession) held at a Hindu temple in Kotagala town, Hatton, has reportedly attacked and injured a person.

title: Former Superintendent of Boossa Prison shot dead
byline: A former Superintendent (SP) of the Boossa Prison, Siridath Dhammika, was shot by an unidentified gunman at Thalagaha in Akmeemana, according to police.

title: O/L exam: Notice on collection of NIC confirmation letters
byline: The Ministry of Digital Economy has announced that G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination candidates who have not yet obtained their National Identity Card (NIC) confirmation letters can collect them on March 15, 2025 (Saturday), from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.

title: Former MP Lakshman Wijemanne quits UNP and joins SJB
byline: Former Member of Parliament for the Kalutara District, Lakshman Wijemanne, has announced his decision to leave the United National Party (UNP) and join the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB).

title: Govt aware of challenges, committed to solutions – President assures university teachers
byline: A meeting between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and academics from the Federation of University Teachers’ Association (FUTA) was held this morning (13) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Person hospitalised following shooting in Weliweriya
byline: A shooting has occurred in the Araliyagaha Junction area of the Weliweriya Police Division, injuring one person, according to police.
